intro: Ficinia swartruggensis, commonly known as the Swartrugger sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant typically grows in wet, swampy areas and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, clustered flowers. Ficinia swartruggensis is often found in riparian zones and is adapted to moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its ecological role includes providing habitat and food for various invertebrates and birds.
